CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 12, 1945, pg. 13, reads: "Purple Hearts - Mrs. Gertrude Angell (left) of Deary Street, Mrs. Rose Bolen (center) of Lowell Street, for whose sons the new Angell Bolen Post, VFW, Homewood, has been named, and Mrs. Cora Perrin (right) of Kelly Street, will thoughtfully peruse the Purple Heart emblem on Mother's Day. The award is shown pinned on Mrs. Bolen's shoulder, while Mrs. Perrin gazes at the decoration.  The sons they lost were Sgt. Eugene Angell, Sgt. William C. Bolen and Pfc. William M. Perrin. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Gold Star mother Cora Perrin holding Purple Heart medal, possibly in her home on Kelly Street, Homewood
